sentences.english: For some reason, their armor was identical to that of the 442nd Siege Battalion.
sentences.chinese: 因为某些因为，他们的装甲与442围攻营雷同。

sentences.english: We have ham sandwiches but the views are essentially the same.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃的是火腿三明治，但是车窗外的景色很雷同。

sentences.english: Succeed because of the difference, sameness cause the failure.
sentences.chinese: 与众不同是成功的开始，雷同流俗是失败的根源。

sentences.english: The cited experimental curves agree analogously with simulation appearances found in this study.
sentences.chinese: 所引用的实验曲线也出现雷同的表现。

sentences.english: The boys' top five looks almost the same as last year.
sentences.chinese: 本年五大最受欢迎的男孩名与客岁大抵雷同。

sentences.english: What is "Identical" bringing us in the present-day society?
sentences.chinese: “雷同”在现今社会带给我们什么？

sentences.english: Commodities cream coated with the effect of maintenance, and direct use is the same.
sentences.chinese: 涂敷乳霜与保养品的后果，和直接服用是雷同的。

sentences.english: Many of POSTMODERNISM's allegedly principal qualities fit cyberpunk like a glove.
sentences.chinese: 据说许多后现代主义的主要特征完全和赛博朋克雷同。

sentences.english: Four, white wine, liquor advertisements identical outer packing showiness.
sentences.chinese: 白酒外包装雷同，白酒广告宣传浮夸。

sentences.english: The tablets are fastened together with hoops of golden-colored alloy suspended from a rod of the same material. So much for the material appearance.
sentences.chinese: 石板被绑缚在一路，用的是雷同材料的金黄色的合金。

sentences.english: I will now fly to Thunder Bluff.
sentences.chinese: 罗尼克说，“我现在飞去雷同崖。

sentences.english: All the stories above are fable, anything happen identical with them are coincidences.
sentences.chinese: 以上故事纯属虚构，如有雷同，纯属巧合。

definition: to be precisely the same/to be no different
virtually the same/differing only on small points
thousand articles, same rule (idiom); stereotyped and repetitive/once you've seen one, you've seen them all
to plagiarize/to copy/to attack the flank or rear of an enemy
to resemble one another/to be alike/similar
exactly the same (idiom)/carbon copy/also pr. [yi1 mo2 yi1 yang4]
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
inconsistent/not in agreement with/not agree or tally with/not conform to
